prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) shows that there is a folding screen dividing the two dining tables, and the one closer to the camera is empty, while the other has the victim collapsed. The caption mentions that no one is sitting across from the victim.

Testimony 1 by Armstrong states: "Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim." This suggests there is a single vantage point to see the victim.

Testimony 2 states: "Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting."

The contradiction arises between the implication from Evidence 12, especially the photo caption stating no one was sitting across from the victim, while Testimony 2 asserts that there was a seat next to the victim's, occupied by the old man, who presumably could have seen the victim, apparently contradicting the claim of no one sitting across the victim.

Thus, the contradiction lies between Evidence 12 and Testimony 2.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La victim, Monsieur Elg, 'e came to my restaurant alone.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im, just after 2 PM.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: Z'ere were no other customers.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: When 'e got word 'e won la lottery, Mon. Elg became very excited.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was approximately 5 minutes later z'at la poisoning incident occurred.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 6
Testimony: Non, z'ere was no time for a phony to do la acting.
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 3 (Sports Paper) has a doodle by the victim from December 3rd, the day of the incident. According to Evidence 10 (Glen's Autopsy Report), the time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM on the same day.

However, Testimony 1 and Testimony 2 by Armstrong conflict with one another. Testimony 1 says the old man arrived not long after Glen Elg, but does not specify a time. Testimony 2 says the old man arrived just after 2 PM, which is during the window of the time of death according to the autopsy.

Testimony 3 states that there were no other customers, which could conflict if the old man and possibly others were indeed present.

However, a clearer contradiction is between Testimony 6 and other statements: Armstrong claims there was no time for a phony to do the acting, contradicting the fact that Maggey was found guilty "thanks to the phony me" (Character 4 description). 

But for evidence and testimony contradiction, a more solid pair is:

Evidence 13 (Coffee Cup) indicates the coffee contained potassium cyanide with fingerprints of the victim and Maggey, indicating Maggey had the coffee cup that poisoned Glen.

Testimony 3: Armstrong says there were no other customers, but Maggey is a waitress and was present. This suggests a contradiction—if no others were present, could Maggey have been at the table?

Alternatively, considering Testimony 0, Armstrong says "the victim came to my restaurant alone," which contradicts Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) that shows no one sitting across the victim.

But this is not necessarily contradictory—it could be the victim was alone at the table.

More explicit contradiction:

Evidence 14: Victim's Lottery Ticket was found during a body search of Maggey. This implies Maggey stole or possessed the lottery ticket.

Testimony 0: Armstrong says the victim came alone, and Evidence 4 (Job Listings) and Evidence 23 (MC Bomber) relate to Tender Lender but do not directly contradict.

Testimony 1 and 2 contradict each other in the time the old man arrived, but both are testimonies, no evidence.

So, the strongest contradiction between evidence and testimony:

Evidence 13: Coffee Cup with cyanide, fingerprints of victim and Maggey.

Testimony 3 by Armstrong says: "There were no other customers."

Given Maggey is a waitress, and to have fingerprints on the cup implies some customer contact. The testimony denies the possibility of anyone else, but Maggey as waitress would have access.

But maybe this is ambiguous.

A more direct contradiction:

Evidence 6: Small Bottle (victim's ear medicine) found covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.

Evidence 19: Millionaire Radio Flyer shows thrilling ten minutes every Monday at 1:30 PM.

Evidence 20: Glen's Calendar shows note "Meet with The Tiger" on Dec. 3rd.

Testimony 2: Armstrong says old man arrived just after 2 PM.

So if Glen died between 1:30 and 2:30 PM, and met "The Tiger" at that time, but Armstrong says old man arrived just after 2 PM, implying event happened within an hour.

So no direct contradiction.

Another contradiction:

Evidence 16: Potassium Cyanide powder bears Maggey's fingerprints, found in her apron pocket.

Testimony 3: Armstrong says no other customers.

Evidence 14: Found Victim's Lottery Ticket on Maggey — suggests link.

But no direct contradiction.

Finally, after analysis, the clearest contradiction is between:

Evidence 2: Magazine Clipping says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.

Character 4: Maggey was found guilty.

Testimony 6: Armstrong says "No, there was no time for a phony to do the acting," contradicting that a fake version of me was used to convict Maggey.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Armstrong's "no time for a phony" and the fact that the phony me was used to get Maggey guilty.

Therefore, the pair is:

Evidence 2 (Magazine Clipping - I was trounced and my client was found guilty, because of the phony me) contradicts Testimony 6 (Armstrong says no time for phony acting).

But evidence 2 doesn't describe the phony directly, but the description of Character 4 (Maggey) says "was found guilty thanks to the phony me," which conflicts with Testimony 6.

Hence, picking the pair:

Evidence 2 (Magazine Clipping) and Testimony 6.

cot: The contradiction lies between Testimony 4 and Evidence 27. Tigre says, "Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta," implying that Violetta can verify his alibi. However, Evidence 27 shows Viola's (Violetta's) medical papers with a $1 million bill for cranial surgery due last year, which contradicts the idea that Violetta was with Tigre to verify his alibi; the bill suggests she was dealing with a medical issue and likely unavailable to confirm his whereabouts.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 20 (Glen's Calendar) notes that on Dec. 3rd, the victim had a meeting scheduled with The Tiger.

Testimony 3 (Furio Tigre) states: "I waited around for him, but he ain't ever showed."

The contradiction arises because the calendar suggests the meeting was planned and presumably expected to take place, indicating Glen Elg would have shown up. However, Furio Tigre's testimony claims Glen never showed up to the meeting at all.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which contains the note "Meet with The Tiger" on Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident. This suggests that Glen was supposed to meet Furio Tigre that afternoon.

Testimony 4 by Tigre states: "I heard the cop's sirens on my way out, and I went straight back to my office." This implies that Tigre left the scene only after hearing the sirens, meaning he was at or near the location during the incident.

Testimony 0 by Tigre states: "I was supposed to meet wid the kid at the restaurant that afternoon." This suggests he was expected to be at the restaurant, but the exact time is not clear.

If we consider that the time of death of Glen Elg (Evidence 10) was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM, and that Tigre was at the restaurant during the incident (or shortly before the arrival of sirens), then Tigre's statement that he was supposed to meet Glen at the restaurant is consistent. However, the exact timing and Tigre's presence are ambiguous but not necessarily contradictory.

Looking for a more direct contradiction:

Evidence 6 mentions that the small bottle found in the kitchen is the victim's ear medicine covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.

Testimony 0-4 by Tigre do not mention anything about being in the kitchen or handling ear medicine.

But this is not a clear contradiction, as fingerprints could have been left anytime, not necessarily at the time of the incident.

Checking other evidence and testimony pairs:

Evidence 9 is Victor's Note: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"

Testimony 18: Victor's Testimony: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."

These do not contradict each other.

Evidence 14: Victim's Lottery Ticket, a winning ticket for half a million dollars, was found during a body search of Maggey (the waitress found guilty due to the phony me).

If Maggey had never seen Glen before (from Character 6 description), then how did she have his lottery ticket?

This is contradictory: Maggey's guilt was based on owning the victim's lottery ticket, but the character description says Maggey had never seen Glen.

No testimony directly addresses this, so it's not a pair.

Another candidate:

Evidence 13: Coffee Cup contained potassium cyanide, with victim and Maggey's fingerprints on it.

Evidence 16: Potassium Cyanide powder found in Maggey's apron pocket, with her fingerprints.

If Maggey was guilty of poisoning Glen with the coffee, then Furio Tigre's fingerprints on the ear medicine bottle (Evidence 6) could conflict if the ear medicine bottle was the poisoning method.

But Toxicology shows death was from potassium cyanide in the coffee cup (Evidence 13). So poisoning via ear medicine seems unlikely.

The contradiction seems to be that Furio Tigre's fingerprints on the ear medicine bottle (Evidence 6) contradicts the fact that the coffee cup was poisoned and the victim's ear medicine bottle only had Furio's fingerprints.

If Furio was involved, his testimony does not admit to being there or handling the medicine.

So, between Furio's testimony (0-4) and Evidence 6, there is a contradiction: Furio does not mention being at the kitchen or handling the ear medicine, yet his fingerprints are found on the poison bottle.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 14 (Victim's Lottery Ticket) shows that Glen Elg had a winning ticket for half a million dollars, which he possessed during the incident.

Testimony 7 from Tigre states: "I was after the $100,000. I didn't have no other reason to kill the guy!"

These two contradict because Tigre claims his motive was $100,000, yet the evidence shows Glen had already won half a million dollars (much more than $100,000), indicating Tigre's stated motive is inconsistent with the actual amount involved.
